extendedInfo.description: This plugin for "DGT GTD & ToDo" implements additional features and services.Available features:- Dropbox Backup / Restore- Dropbox Synchronization- FTP SynchronizationDropboxÂ® is registered trademark (http://www.dropbox.com).DGT GTD is not affiliated with or endorsed by the Dropbox Company.

reviews.title: Flawless!
reviews.comment: Finally have a cloud-based backup using Dropbox.  Quick, convenient, and easy.  Just waiting for the sync upgrade so I can sync my tablet with my phone!  Absolute perfection...and it is still in alpha!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Vital backup function
reviews.comment: I have been using Dropbox for my data from Windows pc programs for a couple of years and found it absolutely reliable.  For sometime I have been uneasy with my backups for GTD being only on my Android tablet SD card.  Now I am pleased to be backing up these precious GTD files on both my SD card AND my old friend Dropbox.  I primarily use a Samsung Galaxy 10.1 Tablet.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A vital backup solution!
reviews.comment: Many thanks to DGTALE for creating an easy and sensible backup solution for DGT GTD. It worked flawlessly the first time for me.     One important point is that you must set up a Dropbox account, and then install Dropbox Mobile on your phone, both ahead of time - don\'t attempt to utilize the Value Pack until you\'ve done those things.    Once you have a Dropbox account, and have installed the Mobile version on your phone, you should be able to see the \"sdcard + Dropbox\" option on your phone.  Do this:  Open DGT GTD.  From either of the 3 main screens (Folders, Main or Goals) tap the gear icon (settings) on lower right.  You should be on the Utilities screen. On the Backup line, it should say \"sdcard\".  Tap the phone\'s Menu. You should see \"Backup destination\" in the bottom left corner.  Tap that, and you should see the \"sdcard + Dropbox\" choice.  I can\'t duplicate it after the initial setup, but I recall some easy popup screen to OK to allow connecting to Dropbox at that point.  Once it\'s working it will create new folders in Dropbox called Apps\\DGT-GTD\\backup, and every time you tap the Backup button it will create a file in both places with a .json.zip file extension.    Awesome!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ragazzina
